column4: The design of this building captured many people's eyes and myself! If you want see the whole city, I recommend you to got to the top of the building free access to everyone. Sometimes there're also orchestra performances on the 1st floor. Check their website.- Coffee shop- free wifi (no password needed)- computer- washroom

Haligonians are very proud of their new library, as well they should be. It serves not only as a repository of books but also as a vibrant community center of sorts. From its fun external design (it's meant to look like a pile of books) to its modern, light-filled interior, the place hums with activity. Espresso shops on both the...

This is a must on your list of places to see and things to do while in Halifax. The design, both inside and out, is fascinating. The layout allows for lots of private space to read or study. Everything is well marked and presented. The children's section is very well thought out. When we were there, the library was extremely...

fantastic for a quiet read orA GOOGLE SEARCH and more. a coffee and snack at Pavia goes well with a good novel, or trip to the children's area with the young book enthusiast Go to the roof for a look over downtown Halifax.
A must see when visiting Halifax! The Library won multiple architecture awards when built and is more than a conventional library.
Just walk through this amazing structure and you'll be greatly rewarded. Multiple exciting and inviting spaces which house activities from A to Z.
A beautiful building that is well laid out and the small Cafe serves great food at reasonable prices

Locating books and media items is easy to do. The library 'flows' and is bright and airy. Staff are courteous and always willing to help. The roof-top cafe and outdoor eating area are great for summer as well.

Really impressed with the exterior and interior of this new library. Great views on top of the building on the patio (closed in the winter though). The bistro/cafe area looked really good but I didn't stop for food or coffee. A welcome addition to the downtown area!
This is the best library you would every visit. Dont mind the teenager and ladies with multiple kids. Just go on higher floors and leave level 2 for ladies with multiple kids (>3-4).

I can understand why this library won so many awards. It is a gem. New urban, public spaces have, sadly, become few and hard to find. This library is both grand and intimate. Its graceful architecture makes one feel like they could be in any grand city space in the world, but it is also accessible for everyone.
Not bad for a public library and good reception and customer service. Also, it is clean and beautiful.
It was a great experience to visit a busy library. People of all ages were in the library! We stopped by to see the building, but if I lived in Halifax I would certainly be a patron of the library.
I didn't go in. We did a drive by where I got out of the taxi for about 10 minutes and photographed this very interesting building. Definitely swing by if in the area.
Easily accessible by bus from anywhere in the greater Halifax area. Modern, clean, features music and art on weekends

The new public library is a breath of fresh air is downtown Halifax. The modern architecture has been welcomed by the locals and the library is a hub of activity. Remember to go to the top floor for the fantastic cityscape views.
I am very impressed by the library, any visitor or resident should "check it out". Halifax is lucky to have such a wonderful central library.
Love this place. Great coffee shop inside. Music is sometimes played live in the theater. Multiple levels with great seating. Lots of magazines to browse. Friendly and helpful staff. AWESOME!

My friends and I dropped in here while visiting Halifax. We had heard a lot about the library and had some time to kill and we were walking by and decided to visit. Very glad we did! It's a beautiful and very relaxing building. Lots of material to browse and read, great reading nooks, good WiFi, a cafe, rooftop seating,...

This library showed up on most "Top Ten Things to Do in Halifax," so we decided to check it out. This wound up being the highlight of the trip for the kids! It's a gorgeous, modern, efficient and well-planned library. We recently read "Escape from Mr. Lemoncello's Library," and the first thing my boys said was that this library looked...

Fabulous library... open and bright and comfortable chairs ..great magazine section...I've always thought that one can tell the kind of town one inhabits by its library and Halifax has a really really good one!!
Halifax proved that if you spend enough money on a Library you can get it right. Spacious, bright, modern, inclusive, and great specialty areas. I cannot find fault.
a fascinating building architecturally and functionally. Individual areas are separated for certain interests as well as a very good children Center and an auditorium.
Amazing public space with private reading areas for everyone , amazing views of the city and a wonderful cafe !!

This beautiful new Library in Halifax has it all. Lots and lots of public computer space, and reading areas. The outside walls of the building are all glass and the interior is flooded with natural light. There are public rooms and espresso bars on the lower and top floors. It is well staffed and I enjoy just dropping by to...
I go at least once a week. There are often excellent concerts, talks, films to attend. There are two coffee shops, some of the best views in town, and a beautiful, light filled building.

The last time I was here, it was...ok. Most time I go the library for an event, I usually have a great time. The last time, what was advertised was not what I saw or was led to believe was going to be shown. Other than the one mishap event, every time I've gone, I've enjoyed myself.
it was my first visit to the new library. What a fantastic additon for Halifax. This will be great for generations
Great activities for young children. The Lego table was great for young minds to develop and use their imagination

This is a must visit building in Halifax. With the digital age, libraries have had to reinvent their role not only has a place to borrow books (including digital ones along with media) but also as a gathering place. This place has been very busy since it opened with a wide variety of the population enjoying a stunning building off...

A must see for locals and visitors alike.Our new Library in the city centre has taken its position as a popular stop for coffee and a snack. While there admire the unique award winning architecture, enjoy the multi purpose spaces which include an auditorium, community computers and more.

This is an architectural masterpiece, well worth seeing just for the building. The cream on top is the wonderful library inside! Plus there is a cafe on the top floor. This is open to the public with free entry. There is a parking garage underneath, with plenty of room the day I was there.Halifax is on very steep hills,...

As a local I love going to the library. Beside the books, I love that you can look out over the city on the top floor, giving a different perspective. Pavia Cafe is very good, delicious coffee and food, if a little expensive.

All I can say is that if you don't like to read, visit this library and you will change your mind. When it was being built I was determined not to like it "too modern" "too flashy" blah blah blah. I've Changed! Lots and lots of space - lots and lots of people but because it is so open you...

It is a delight to enter this new building. It is spectacular, everything you would expect in a library and more. Also offers many free concerts on the main level as well as a meeting space for community groups.

As a local, I take a lot of pride in our central library. I use it to loan various books and movies on a regular basis. The library is worth visiting for its architecture. Its biggest value from a travellers perspective is that it offers free Wi-Fi and there are computers (and printers) available. There is also a coffee shop....

This library will blow you out of the water. Extraordinary internationally recognized architecture is focused on what a library is supposed to do: offer approachable free literary services to all. Highly recommedmed for reading, browsing, eating and viewing the city from its "living room". It will astound and please you.
Love the new library! Such a great location! Beautiful and so many options for books, movies, treats.

Another one to add to my list of the best libraries I’ve visited around the world. This is pretty new with lovely views, lots of seating and a fantastic cafe (with views) that offers local produce.It's geared up for kids with activities and free bags to carry books in. Plus there are exhibitions and tons of magzines. A great...
It was a very interesting place. A roof top terrace with a cafe style seating and cafe and yummy treats. Very cozy and comfortable indeed.Beautiful inside and out.

An open and bright beauty....great place to relax with a cup of cofffee and a good book! Or do some research and wifi, computers or hang out...bike racks outside, on the bus routes, helpful friendly staff.

This library has something for everyone! All forms of media are available from magazines, newspapers, computer terminals, gaming for young and old and, of course, books. The staff is incredible, the coffee shop is excellent and the view from the fifth floor is not to be missed. It has become the hub of the city!

Halifax's Central Library is a jewel in the community. Peruse the catalogs, choose your books and sit outside on the Pavia 5th floor terrace with your coffee to read and to view the harbour and the cityscape. Or go with your child and visit the children's reading or play station. Or perhaps you want to attend one of the talks...
A great place to gather for a coffee, attend a discussion, computer based projects for the young, middle age and us older folks.
Beautiful brand new library with something for everyone. Two cafe's onsite. The views from the top are incredible. Visit if only to tour this beautiful building.
This is the library of my dreams! Nice open spaces, 2 cafés and a rooftop terrace! Plenty of rooms and activities. Family friendly (you can eat, play and talk!).
A friend brought my wife and I here and I was simply amazed by this facility. Halifax hit it out of the park with this library.

When you think of library you think of dark, quiet and not fun. Not this one. It is new, fresh, bright, lots going on, and very kid friendly. It is a hub of the city. The coffee shop is awesome. Well worth a stop in.

What a wonderful addition to our city.I think libraries have always counted among the populace of my city but having an award winning building has helped showcase the exceptional service the staff provide to our province and city.
Having a place in city where people of all ages can go to relax or hang out and read or grab a coffee is just what the city needed.
Build 3 years ago in central Halifax. Award winning designer who designed the building with a stack book appearance. Has become a gathering place for the city.
Wonderful architectural design, neat reading nooks, huge selection, friendly staff and easy to get around. Great place to spend an afternoon.
Great experience. Helpful staff. It was very clean and spacious. I liked that I could drink my coffee while browsing. Also nice that there are 2 locations to eat at.

Wow, wow, wow! This was my first time in the new library and I have to say that the architecture and vibe blew me away. It really has brought libraries into this century. Nice to see the wide open spaces, the auditorium, the coffee shop and the accessible and friendly staff.

This is a beautifully designed building well worth visiting. Obviously you can borrow books and videos if you are a resident, but if you are from out of town there is computer access and places to do research, especially historical and genealogical. The library is very open with a big central five story tall open central area. There is a...

We've been to the new library several times since it opened. It's beautiful from the outside and interesting and attractive inside. Whether you're looking for something to read as in a traditional library or a quiet(ish) place to read, write or reflect, a bite to eat, a place for your children to play or watch a video, a view of...

It is amazing.....so much nicer than the old library. Coffee shop right inside the building. Nice space for reading. Staff were great and very helpful. Location was good and parking was available near by. Hope to spend more time my next visit.
The design of this library was amazing. The outdoor spaces were nice too. They have really done a wonderful job on this building, and it puts a lot of libraries to shame.

I live in Dartmouth, so wasn't that excited about the new central library. Then I went there for a free comedy show as a part of Ha!ifax. Stunning! Stunning design. Excellent resource for the downtown community. I wish I lived a little closer so I could visit more often.

This library won awards for it's architectural design...it is spectacular! The library is visually interesting and stunning!Inside is equally interesting.I especially love all the nooks and crannies to sit and read,do school work...or just chill.There is a great coffee bar in there to try.Spend some time and take a tour around.

The new library was admired for its architecture and we found it really is an exceptional place inside too. Very convenient underground parking, very open space..no crowding everything in, beautiful glass walls with great city and harbour views, countless computer terminals and comfortable reading spots/desks, excellent small cafes on each floor and spotless washrooms. A great variety of programs advertised...
Unusual library. Top floor and bottom floor bistros with great eats.Open areas, lots of seating, lots of windows. Lots of books.Good vibes.
this library is well designed and well staffed to satisfy the needs of all ages . A simply wonderful place to spend time reading, writing, listening.
Well laid out and thought out facility, full of everything any young or older scholar could need in any academic activity.
Very modern and vast information available here.Right downtown and a sight to be seenOn local bus routes and not a far walk from the ferryCheck it out
Worth the time to take walk around the building before heading inside. It's a great example of modern architecture.

So they say. I'm not sure impressive isn't a better word. It has been designed so successfully that it's a pleasure to be in it.It has lovely views from its glass windows which make up most of it, an easy atmosphere, two coffee shops, many pretty coloured seats and is a joy to see.

This library is bright, clean and has comfortable seating/ reading areas. A theatre features diverse entertainment and two coffee shops on site offer above average snacks. Good selection of both paper and digital books, movies and games and computers.

From the award winning architecture of the building to the content inside this Library is simply amazing. I think the city thought about 500,000 would visit it annually but more than 1.5 million have shown up! Inside you will find areas for study groups, individual studies, children interactive centres and so much more. There is a recording studio and a...

Totally contemporary library - beautiful, so much to do and see in there - great research facilities - multi media opportunities. Can't say enough good things about this terrific library. You can have coffee on the ground floor or on the top floor - great cafe space and lots of places to read quietly with amazing vistas when you want...
Stunning space. Great scenery and people watching. Books & events galore. Awesome staff. Coffee shops (yes two). Love it.

Not only is it visually appealing, but it is being used for many community activities. Given with everything going on linr these days, one wondered why we were spending56 million on a library. Ut if you look at thecalendar of activities, it has become a new community centre sparking all sorts of events. I just went to one last week...

The architecture is breathtaking. With airy white walls and an open central court with a sweeping staircase up the middle. It is worth your time to make your way to the top floor to experience the cantilevered reading room. You fly over the street in a glass in room. The collection of books is very diverse and I always find...
It is a wonderful building. Nice location. Friendly staff. Great indoor decorations. There is even a cafeteria downstairs.
The new library building is quite interesting architecturally. Inside is very open, nice clean ares. Private rooms available for functions.

A must see on your walking tour of downtown Halifax. A great 360 degree vantage point, a lovely café for a meal or snacks on the top floor adjacent to a rooftop patio, and a very comfortable place to sit and read. Well done.
This new library adds greatly to the city. Architecturally interesting it is also technically excellent. And has a great coffee shop!
I like books. I love reading - and writing! If you happen to go by the Halifax Central Library, don't hesitate: go in! It is stunning. And there is a nice café, a rooftop terrace, and... a view!
I had friends visiting and wanted them to see this beautiful building and enjoy the rooftop terrace. We each had soups or paninis and they were delicious!

Good for you Halifax - approving the design if this stunning building. Not only is it impressive from the outside, but the inside is so open and inviting. If more libraries were like this we might all read more books!

With the advent of E readers I had pretty much abandoned regular trips to the library. The Halifax Central Library changed that in a big way. Here's why....Firstly the place is an amazing, award winning piece of architecture. This is doubly amazing for a place like Halifax where architecture usually means a slab sided high ride glass box full...

Great views of the city and terrific architecture inside the library which was made to sit for awhile.Have a cup of coffe from the café and pick out a book to read.Agreat place to visit on a rainy day

This library in Halifax is a must go to attraction. It was recommended to me by the concierge at my hotel, and I was a little puzzled as to why I sent there, so I decided to give it a try. The architecture of this building is outstanding. The layout was well thought of, and so much to look at...

We visited the library on a rainy day weekend as recommended by locals (Visit a library ? Are you sure?). The place was full. We went to the fifth floor for the view and enjoyed a delicious light lunch . Worth the trip and the view is superb (on s sunny of course). Everything is well though in order to...

Very proud to see something like this structure built in my home city. Interesting design for sure and nice rooftop gardens. Also nice to have a cafe up there as well. And oh yes, it's also a library...

I love the halifax central library, it's the perfect place to study. There's so many separate little places you can spread out and study your life away! It's also beautiful and airy feels very welcoming. Doesn't feel like a dusty old library.
Popped in during Nocturne. Lovely modern building. Didn't look at resources only stopped to see the art exhibit and grabbed a coffee on the ground floor. Great coffee!
My favorite place to, yes, read. Inside on the main floor in the big chairs, top floor by the overhanging window section, outside in the chairs in the sun. I love this building
Must not miss this new Halifax landscape. It's really something to see. It's all glass and the top floor is amazing. You need to see it to believe it

Ribbon cutting ceremony for the Southwest Reading Room at the Halifax Public Library took place a few weeks ago and this comfortable area of the library is open to all, with the latest newspapers, magazines, and interesting publications for all who wish to drop in, relax and read. The seating consists of comfortable seats and couches with a beautiful view....

This library has a spirit of community and welcome! I felt at home when I entered the first time. It is spacious, beautiful, light, and above all, welcoming. This is not always the way I have felt in libraries. There are lots of nooks and crannies to explore a book, check on line for information, or sit and admire some...

To view the building from the outside is not enough, though it is a wonderful spectacle and a brilliant piece of art. To really appreciate it you have to enter the building and allow yourself to be consumed by it cathedral like feeling and the awesome public space. A must see when in halifax.
The Halifax Central Library on Spring Garden Road is an architectural marvel and is equally as spectacular inside.

This is the best library I've ever had the pleasure of using.If you are only passing through, it's worth visiting for the architecture and the view. Get a coffee from the top floor and soak in the harbour.

Read about the public library and so happy to have seen it. Open spaces are warm, modern and inviting. The exterior avante guarde, public places to sit and gather.Frankly surprising for we did not expect this of Halifax!
Very fun, informative, free day at the Library. There were many options for singles, groups, children and families.

Not your typical tourist attraction but really very interesting building, with great vistas from the top floor. Super contemporary in style. A recommended site from some locals we met. The 5th floor has 360* views of Halifax port, citadel and surrounding buildings. Wonderful floor to ceiling windows allow copious amounts of natural light and sofas a quiet respite from the...
This is one of the coolest libraries I have ever visited , the technology and special areas of usage for all ages
Halifax should be very proud of this library. It's is beautiful ! Glad we where recommended to go see.
A beautiful new building. So well designed. I was there with an 8 year old and she just loves the place. A must visit for tourists too.
I have been to libraries all across the world and this is my absolute favorite! Lots of open space and free activities for the public happening pretty much every day it's open!

Every thing about Halifax's new Central Library is amazing. The architecture, layout of the collections, the children's areas, concert and meeting halls, and don't forget to visit the fifth floor coffee shop. Excellent food ( a local supplier) and fantastic 360 degree views over all of Halifax. A must see, especially for bookophiles!
This is a library like none other. It is amazing to sit out on the cantilevered section and look out over the city. When the weather is cooperative, you can eat your lunch on the roof.
Amazing place that is not just a LIbrary, you could easily spend the day here. Fabulous coffee shop on the top floor with rooftop terrace overlooking Halifax.

Even if you are not into libraries the Halifax Central Library is a must see visit, have a special coffee at one of two cafes, go onto the roof top patio for a view of Halifax and the harbor, read the paper or just plain relax.

I just dropped in to see the library, have a rest and get a coffee.I asked for my standard flat white expecting a drip coffee and milk or coffee capsule.I was delighted to get a great flat white perfectly made.Only issue was the huge cups but I told the guy to only fill it 3/4 full. Perfect!?

Where to begin? Architecturally stunning, accessible, state of the art, and free of charge breathtaking views of the city. It is so welcoming yet modern and encourages one to take advantage of all the resources available to anyone visiting. Even if don't read books, there are countless magazines, newspapers, art displays and 2 excellent, affordable cafes. The building is environmentally...
The Halifax Central Library is well worth the visit even if you don't want to check out the books. There is a terrace on the roof which is worth checking out and a couple of cafés in the library.

For library lovers, the Halifax Central is a must-see destination, but even if you're not a fan, it's worth a quick peek. The architecture (which resembles the pile of books constantly at my bedside) is photo-worthy, both inside and out. The top floor coffee shop is a great place to get excellent coffee at an incredibly reasonable price--with a great...

Love the architecture. Looks like a stack of books sitting on the ground. Lot's of glass gives you a sense of freedom and connection whether you are outside looking in or inside looking out. Definitely worth and drive-by and a picture if not a stop in.

This brand new library is a special treat as it is not as grungy as the usual types people go to. It's brand new, has cafes, lots of space, comfy chairs to sit and read a book and the best part is at the very top. You have a great view of halifax from the top floor and there is...

The new Halifax central library is probably one of the most inviting designs for public space that I've ever seen. There are so many areas, both indoors and outside the building that are set up to encourage people to stay, relax and enjoy the library. It starts right in front of this modern building with a variety of permanent seating...
What a library, superb design and magical place to study, learn and be part of the commmunity. The roof top cafe offers excellent views, and coffee too.

I've never seen a library like this before.This is not your mother's library.It reminds me of an apple store combined with a Chapters, Starbucks and library all in one.Two coffee shops top and bottom, there is an outdoor patio to enjoy your books and coffee. Lots of high tech resources.I was just traveling I couldn't really...

As soon as I walked in, I knew I'd be staying a while and even ended up returning twice during my stay. It's a very modern/contemporary library with a unique architecture that reflects Halifax's progression as a city. Also it has a strong community sense feel to it. What I mean by that is it's the kind of place you...

I absolutely love this library. It is a piece of art. It is so amazing to walk around and look at and there are so many different spots to sit and read a book. I like how there are cafes on both the ground and the top floor.Be aware though, this library is always packed. I never come here...

Great library. A splurge for the city, but with the wonderful attention its already brought us, I say money well spent. Modern, but very welcoming and makes you want to read everything :) I've heard the food is good too (if a bit pricy). Nice roof top in the summer.
This library has an incredible design. We were drawn in and were lucky enough to catch a free concert. Definitely worth a visit.

Went for the annual "Word on the Street". Met some interesting Authors and purchased several books, including "The Most Heartless Town in Canada" by Elaine McCluskey. Library is very well laid out and just got voted as top 10 libraries in the world!!!~ Not bad for Halifax.
This building is outstanding! Go to each floor and check out the various options. Plus a roof top cafe and a wonderful vista of the city. And it's FREE!
We come here quite a lot & it's a wonderful place. It's huge, clean & the staff is excellent. Really enjoy our visits with the kids here. Plenty of computers to use as well! ?
The library is not just about books. It has 2 wonderful cafes with friendly staff. Lots of great study spots. It's worth a visit just to check out the great design.

Such a modern library with stunning architecture. Head to the 5th floor to check out the views from the big glass box sun room with comfy chairs to read in, and then grab a coffee from the cafe up there and go out to the rooftop for even better views. Take the elevator up and the stairs back down to...
If you have even the slightest interest in beautiful buildings, do not miss this stunning new library. The interior spaces are as interesting as the exterior.
Stunning architecture. Great art installations. Super comfortable. Lots of different spaces than you can choose based on mood. Inventive programs.
Absolutely loved it. Beautiful, modern, clean, lots of natural lighting, amazing roof top patio. Cannot wait to visit again.
This library is a great location for locals and tourists alike. Community minded talks and great coffee and deserts are a part of this visit. Go to the rooftop Cafe for a wonderful view of the city.
This Library is absolutly amazing! You must see it if not to actually read a book or have a quick lunch or cup of coffee. It has everything for everyone and is a design masterpiece. Enjoy

The Halifax Public Library is a gorgeous building in downtown Halifax. It's in a terrific location, which is actually undergoing a lot of change - condos being built across the street, down the street, etc.Inside there are a great many quiet places to go to read and contemplate. On the first and top floors there are cafes to get...

Just a joy to experience, by yourself, with children or just to have a coffee and check out an old or new favourite book. I had to find a place to study and do some research. It was perfect and staff really helpful.
Great library in a district close to shopping and lots of restaurants & pubs. This new library has won an award for one of the most beautiful libraries in the world.

The Halifax Central Library isn't just a book repository, it's one of the greenest buildings in North America, and built to last. Their partnerships with groups of community interest bring educational and entertainment programs from near and far. Also, there's a lot of space to just lounge and read or write or sip a latte that you bought in one...

My wife wanted to see this building after seeing it on the computer, when we got there it was indeed interesting but we were both underwhelmed. Cool architecture and there is an observation area on the roof but there is not much to see from that angle except for a modern skyline. There is an awesome book transport/return system which...
Beautifully designed, very modern library. Extremely well set out. Plenty of books(!). Nice cafes and free internet. Rooftop has a café with gtreat views over the city.

What an architecturally beautiful building! Easy to miss, since it looks like a contemporary part of the college campus surrounding it....and doesn't actually say LIBRARY on the building....we had to ask if we were in the right place.Go to the observation deck for the best view of Halifax.....and the coffee shop is the best around...I was told by...

What a great way to spend a couple of hours! Ultra modern award winning setting with everything you need. When we arrived we went straight up to the rooftop cafe for coffee and a bite to eat. We sat outdoors and took pics of the beautiful scenery. Then we went down to the third floor and browsed some magazines while...

I love everything about this library. It's beautifully designed with large open spaces that let you think. There are multiple nice cafes to drink espresso etc at or have some snacks.There are computers available and just about any service you could want from a library.Also a great place to sit and just people watch.
Awesome, unique, modern even if you dont read it is worth a visit . 3 D printer. Internet accessible. Food services available. Tremendous location for students. and visitors

It is my kids favourite library. It is two floor building. Big space with high ceiling. State of art building design with different room and designated space for free play, computer games area. Reading tables. Coffee shop in main floor to sit and talk and have a snack. I didn't explore the main floor well. I am always with my...

Great views of the city and a super neat library! It is very active within the community and wish I had had more time for browse around. Nice little cafe on the top floor also. This picture is the book check-out area. It is a really neat wall with cell phone size art work all over it.
If you are into libraries then check this out. If you are not then just go in and see the view from the top glassed in balcony.

I went to a wedding in this location, and while the rules are pretty strict because they need to maintain the books, etc, the building is absolutely gorgeous, the view is incredible, and the onsite catering was amazing. The food was great and the servers were the best.It's a real gem of architecture worth checking out if you're in...

The public library has been the best addition to Halifax in the past few years. It promotes culture, learning and community development. The building is beautifully built and really modern. The view of the cafe on the 5th floor is simply stunning.I highly recommend visiting the public library whenever you're in Halifax :)!

The library was recommended to us by our hotel as it was rainy day. We were delighted by how bright and spacious it was. We spent the afternoon playing with lego and a board game. My 6 year old didn't get bored once.
we went here because it was an amazing building with glass all around and four floors. It was even more spectacular.

The new Halifax Library is a place you need to visit in Halifax. The modern architecture alone, is worth the visit. It's many floors and nooks and grannies offer readers many places to browse for the many books that interest them and places to sit and relax. The rooftop patio is just lovely. You can enjoy a lunch from the...

This library is very modern and well laid out. We took a walk through just to see what it looked like. It if very functional and has lots of space and levels. There were many workshops going on. The view of the city from the upper floor is wonderful.

You can go have a cup of coffee-tea out on their patio. The kids have a play area. A tremendous view from all sides and windows to look through from floor to ceiling. Many study areas with plugin's for your computer. Must go to on your vacation or trip. You will not be disappointed
I got a bit lost in this library, but it was lovely. We really liked the furniture, but there wasn't enough of it for everyone to use, including us!
A good architectural construction with modern look and great functionality. Amazing collection of all media and useful for the public. The number of people using this facility is really high.

I am often telling tourists to visit our new library and to head to the top floor for great views of the city and harbor. If you are a local and haven't been in yet what are you waiting for? This is a busy community library that is a pleasure to visit.
Our Son's wedding reception was held on the fifth floor. There were floor to ceiling windows with a panoramic view of the city.
Great library, great architecture, you can go to the rooftop patio and admire the view of the beautiful city!
This is one of the most modern buildings in HRM. This new central library was opened to public in 2014. It had five storeys height and a perfect place for learning and relaxing

Even if you don't go for the books or another event, it's worthy a visit just for the building, top floor features a coffee shop and rooftop patio with beautiful city and Harbour views. Might be a nice spot to watch fireworks,. Top floor also has a beautiful glass space over looking spring garden road

We were told the new Halifax Public Library is lovely. We weren't disappointed. It's a modern, open and welcoming building. Staff are helpful and friendly.
